conclusion: Mass of hemisphere A is m and mass of hemisphere B is 2m; angle between line connecting centers and horizontal is 30°.
Analyze forces to find dynamic friction coefficient between hemisphere A and left wall.
Forces on hemisphere B: weight (2mg) and normal force from hemisphere A.
Normal force from hemisphere A on B resolves into horizontal and vertical components.
Vertical component of normal force balances weight of hemisphere B.
Horizontal component equals normal force exerted by hemisphere A on B.
Forces on hemisphere A: weight (mg), normal force from left wall, normal force from hemisphere B.
Normal force from left wall has horizontal and vertical components.
Vertical component balances weight of hemisphere A.
Horizontal component equals normal force exerted by hemisphere A on left wall.
Horizontal components of normal forces are equal and opposite.
Normal force exerted by hemisphere A on left wall equals normal force from B on A.
Horizontal component of normal force from B on A is (2mg) * cos(30°).
Maximum static friction force equals dynamic friction force (μ * mg).
